post.description: This API is part of Bureau's Offline Know Your Customer (oKYC) suite. This API verifies the captcha entered by the user and generates and sends an OTP to the mobile number linked to the entered Aadhaar number.

sessionId.description: Unique identifier generated by Bureau for the request.

uid.description: Aadhaar number you want to verify. The OTP generated is sent to the mobile number linked to this Aadhaar number.

captcha.description: Captcha entered by your customer. This captcha is matched with the captcha geenrated in the Generate Captcha API. If the captchas match, we generate an OTP and send it to the  mobile number linked to entered Aadhaar number.

sessionId.description: Session id for the oKYC request. This is the same as the value enteres in the request body. You need to pass this in the request body in the Download oKYC APIs.

merchantId.description: Your unique identifier in Bureau's database.

message.description:
Message describing the API status.

Few possible values:
- `OTP Generation Successful`
- `Invalid UID.Please enter valid UID`
- `Captcha value doesn't match`

requestId.description: Unique identifier generated by Bureau for the request.

sessionActive.description:
Indicates the status of the session.

Possible values:
- `true`: Session is active.
- `false`: Session is no longer active. You need to start the oKYC process again by generating a new captcha and asking your customer to verify the new captcha.

status.description:
Indicates if an OTP was generated and sent to the mobile number linked to the entered Aadhaar number.

Possible values
- `true`: OTP was generated and sent to the mobile number linked to the entered Aadhaar number.
- `false`: OTP was not generated. Check the `message` parameter to know why.

statusCode.description: HTTP status code for the response.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp, in milliseconds, when the response was returned.

value.message: Captcha session expired, please try with new Captcha

post.description: This API empowers you to verify an individual's identity using infromation from the Indian Income Tax (IT) Department. This API accepts PAN as the input and returns information such as the PAN holder's name, address, and date of birth.

pan.description:
**Input is case sensitive. Ensure the PAN is in upper case.**

PAN for which you want to get details.

aadhaarLinked.description:
Indicates if an Aadhaar is linked to the PAN.

Possible values:
- `true`: Aadhaar is linked to the PAN. Check `maskedAadhaar` to know the last 4 digits of the linked Aadhaar.
- `false`: No Aadhaar is linked to the PAN.

Possible values:
- `true`: PAN is valid.
- `false`: PAN is not valid.

lastName.description: PAN holder's last name as per PAN records.

locality.description: The locality in which the PAN holder resides as per PAN records.

Masked Aadhaar number linked to the PAN.

Only the last 4 digits are returned unmasked in the response.

name.description: PAN holder's full name as per PAN records.

post.description: With just the document number, this API enables you to instantly access details from various government documents such as PAN, Driving License (DL), Vehicle Registration Certificate (RC), and Goods and Tax (GST) details. It is your one-stop solution for retrieving information directly from government databases.

docType.description:
Type of document for which you want to fetch details.

Possible values:
- `pan`: PAN
- `dl`: Driving license
- `rc-lite`: Vehicle registration certificate
- `gst-lite`: Basic GST information
- `gst-advance`: Detailed GST information

docNumber.description:
Unique identifier for the government document.

Examples for different documents accepted:
- PAN: `ABCPZ0000P`
- Driving license: `KA0336900000619`
- Vehicle registration certificate: `KA03XX0000`
- GST: `07RKOXX0619X1XX`

dob.description:
**Use only when `docType = dl`**.

Date of birth provided by your customer.

Format: `DD-MM-YYYY`

name.description:
Name entered by your customer.

**PAN**: When a name is passed along with the PAN, we match the name from the request with the PAN holder's name as per Indian Income Tax (IT) records.

**Driving license**: When a name is passed along with the driving license number, we match the name from the request with the driving license holder's name as per regional transport office records.

match.description: Indicates if the input `name` matches the PAN holder's name as per IT records.

merchantId.description: Your unique identifier in Bureau's database.

name.description: Indicates if we could retrieve the PAN holder's name from the IT records.

status.description:
Status of the inquiry to retrieve the PAN holder's name from IT records.

Possible values:
- `1`: Success
- `6`:Source unavailable
- `7`: Internal error
- `8`: Unknown error
- `9`: Others

value.description: PAN holder's name as per IT records.

panNumber.description: Indicates if we could find the entered PAN in the IT records.

status.description:
Status of the inquiry to find the entered PAN in the IT records.

Possible values:
- `1`: Success
- `6`:Source unavailable
- `7`: Internal error
- `8`: Unknown error
- `9`: Others

value.description: PAN for which records were retrieved from IT records.

requestId.description: Unique identifier generated by Bureau for the request.

similarity.description:
Name match score between the input `name` and the PAN holder's name as per IT records.

Parameter returns a value between `0` and `100`.

typeOfRegistration.description:
Type of GST certificate the entity has obtained.

Possible values:
- `Regular`: Businesses that have revenue above a specific threshold. They must adhere to all GST rules and regulations and submit GST returns regularly.
- `Composition`: Small companies that have a turnover below a certain threshold. Compared to `Regular` registration, they have fewer compliance obligations and pay a predetermined percentage of their turnover in tax.
- `Casual`: Option for businesses that only periodically or seasonally operate in a state other than their typical location. This enables them to follow GST regulations for those particular transactions.
- `Non-Resident`: Organizations from outside India that provide goods or services are required to register under this category. Aids them in adhering to GST rules and meeting their tax responsibilities.
- `SEZ`: Special Economic Zones (SEZs) have their registration procedure for businesses operating there. They are entitled to special tax breaks and exemptions, but to take advantage of them, they must register individually under the GST scheme.

post.description:
Experience the power of precision with our Bank Statement Analyzer APIs. Our APIs enable you to validate the format of the PDF, ensure the accuracy of account balances for each transaction, verify the trustworthiness of the source of the PDF statement, and confirm the consistency of creation and modification dates.

This API retrieves a list of banks whose statements we are equipped to analyze.

Unique code for the bank.

You need to pass this against the `bankId` parameter in the next API.

Indicates if we can analyze the statement in the JSON format for the bank.

Currently, we do not support analysis of bank statements in the JSON format.

pdf.description:
Indicates if we can analyze the statement in the PDF format for the bank.

Currently, we only support analysis of bank statements in the PDF format.

post.description:
Experience the power of precision with our Bank Statement Analyzer APIs. Our APIs enable you to validate the format of the PDF, ensure the accuracy of account balances for each transaction, verify the trustworthiness of the source of the PDF statement, and confirm the consistency of creation and modification dates.

This API retrieves the analyzed output for the statement you uploaded. Use this API to get the Bank Statement.

applicantId.description:
Unique identifier for the bank statement analysis request.

This is the value against the `applicantId` parameter in the response from the previous API.

token.description:
Unique token for the bank statement analysis request.

This is the value against the `token` parameter in the response from the previous API.

Some possible transaction types and descriptions:
- If credit or debit card transaction: Masked credit or debit card number is returned.
- If UPI transfer: Details about the UPI ID to which money was transferred or from which money was received.
- If account transfer: The method used to perform the transfer such as IMPS, RTGS, and NEFT is returned."

post.description:
Experience the power of precision with our Bank Statement Analyzer APIs. Our APIs enable you to validate the format of the PDF, ensure the accuracy of account balances for each transaction, verify the trustworthiness of the source of the PDF statement, and confirm the consistency of creation and modification dates. The v2 version of our API allows you to upload multiple PDF files in a single API call.

This API retrieves a list of banks whose statements we are equipped to analyze.

bankList.description: List of banks whose statements we can analyze.

code.description:
Unique code for the bank.

You need to pass this against the `bankId` parameter in the next API.

json.description:
Indicates if we can analyze the statement in the JSON format for the bank.

Currently, we do not support analysis of bank statements in the JSON format.

pdf.description:
Indicates if we can analyze the statement in the PDF format for the bank.

Currently, we only support analysis of bank statements in the PDF format.

name.description: Full name of the bank.

merchantId.description: Your unique identifier in Bureau's database.

requestId.description: Unique identifier generated by Bureau for the request.

statusCode.description: HTTP status code for the response.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp, in milliseconds, when the response was returned.

**PAN**: When a name is passed along with the PAN, we match the name from the request with the PAN holder's name as per Indian Income Tax (IT) records.

**Driving license**: When a name is passed along with the driving license number, we match the name from the request with the driving license holder's name as per regional transport office records.

typeOfRegistration.description:
Type of GST certificate the entity has obtained.

Possible values:
- `Regular`: Businesses that have revenue above a specific threshold. They must adhere to all GST rules and regulations and submit GST returns regularly.
- `Composition`: Small companies that have a turnover below a certain threshold. Compared to `Regular` registration, they have fewer compliance obligations and pay a predetermined percentage of their turnover in tax.
- `Casual`: Option for businesses that only periodically or seasonally operate in a state other than their typical location. This enables them to follow GST regulations for those particular transactions.
- `Non-Resident`: Organizations from outside India that provide goods or services are required to register under this category. Aids them in adhering to GST rules and meeting their tax responsibilities.
- `SEZ`: Special Economic Zones (SEZs) have their registration procedure for businesses operating there. They are entitled to special tax breaks and exemptions, but to take advantage of them, they must register individually under the GST scheme.
